entry.title: Learn Swift at Artsy, Beginners Lesson Three
entry.content:
And we're back! With lesson three of the beginners' Swift-at-Artsy course. To recap, Orta and I led a course at Artsy to teach our colleagues Swift last August, and we're doing it again. I'm leading the stream for people who've never programmed before.

Yesterday was lesson three and I have a screen recording of my walkthrough of the material.

entry.title: Learn Swift at Artsy, Beginners Lesson Two
entry.content:
And we're back! With lesson two of the beginners' Swift-at-Artsy course. To recap, Orta and I led a course at Artsy to teach our colleagues Swift last August, and we're doing it again. I'm leading the stream for people who've never programmed before.

Yesterday was lesson two and I have a screen recording of my walkthrough of the material.

entry.title: Learn Swift at Artsy, Beginners Lesson One
entry.content:
Last August, Orta and I led a course at Artsy to teach our colleagues Swift. There were two parallel groups of learners: a "beginners" group who had never coded before, and an "informed" group who already knew how to code. This year, we're leading the course again with a slight twist: we're repeating the course for absolute beginners, and we're introduce a new course for anyone who completed last year's beginner course.

We're really excited both to help new colleagues take their first steps into programming, and to help returning colleagues continue their journey.

Today was lesson one of the beginner group, and I have a screen recording of my walkthrough of lesson one's material.

entry.title: Code Review: Energy Sync
entry.content:
We are slowly trying to do high-level code-review views for all of our iOS apps. So far, we've covered Eidolon and Emergence and now Energy. This is the second part of the Energy code review. The first part covers the the critical codepaths that go from the App's launch to sending an email, which is the main use-case for the app. This video covers how Folio does sync between the Artsy API and the app.

Sync is a complex problem. This video covers our old techniques, how we changed them, the underlying abstractions we use now and how we can test each component individually. It's an hour long, and it's a little computer-sciencey. So I think people who have shipped some small apps would get a lot out of it.

Jump to YouTube for the video, or click more for a smaller inline preview.

entry.title: Code Review: Energy overview
entry.content:
We are slowly trying to do high-level code-review views for all of our iOS apps. So far, we've covered Eidolon and Emergence. Folio is an app that's shipped to the App Store in early 2012, it's used by our Partners to showcase their works offline, at fairs and on the go. If you want the full spiel, check out this microsite.

This video talks through a lot of the critical codepaths that go from the App's launch to sending an email, which is the main use-case for the app. We have another video coming up which exclusively covers how Folio does sync between the Artsy API and the app.

Jump to YouTube for the video, or click more for a smaller inline preview.
